BR_text.BRdescription:
As pointed out by <denchmark-link:https://github.com/szha>@szha</denchmark-link>
  in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/dmlc/gluon-nlp/pull/204>#204</denchmark-link>
  our Readme <denchmark-link:https://pypi.python.org/pypi/gluonnlp>does not render well on Pypi</denchmark-link>
  due to relative links in the Readme.
 In particular there are        ,  links at the top of the Readme, linking to the second half of the document.
 Should we remove the relative links? As the document is not too long I wonder if having these links is worth having the Pypi Readme not being rendered properly.
